'''Florges''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''フラージェス''' ''Florges'') is a {{type|Fairy}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation VI]].

It [[evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Floette}} when exposed to a [[Shiny Stone]]. It is the final form of {{p|Flabébé}}. Its flower can come in [[List of Pokémon with form differences#Flabébé, Floette, and Florges|five different colors]].

==Biology==
Florges is a Pokémon whose green lower body resembles a mermaid's tail with two large leaves blooming on either side of the flukes. Its upper body is white and slender, with sylphlike arms that end in three dainty fingers; it has two black, diamond-like shapes on each side of its svelte torso. Florges's head is rounded with a pointed, upturned nose and long teardrop-shaped ears, while its dark-colored eyes are framed by lengthy green lashes. It no longer carries a single flower like its {{p|Floette|pre-evolution}} did, but instead a large bouquet of ornate flowers around its head. The color of its flowers depends on whether it held a Red, Yellow, Orange, Blue, or White Flower as a {{p|Flabébé}}. Florges claims well-tended flower gardens as its territory, and it basks in energy emitted from flowers to obtain power. Its life can span hundreds of years, and spends its entire life protecting its gardens. It is a female-only species.

==In the anime==
[[File:Blue Flower Florges anime.png|thumb|left|250px|Blue Flower Florges in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
[[File:Trevor Florges.png|thumb|250px|left|White Flower Florges in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Florges (anime)]]====
A Blue Flower Florges debuted in ''[[XY069|Defending the Homeland!]]'', where she was the presumed leader of the group of Pokémon attacking Goodra's wetland. In the end, she was defeated by Goodra's Ice Beam. She did this to protect a Floette, and joined forces with Team Rocket. She reappeared in ''[[XY070|Beyond the Rainbow!]]'', where she learned of Team Rocket's deception and teamed up with Goodra to help defeat them. She reappeared in ''[[XY112|Master Class is in Session!]]'', ''[[XY113|Performing a Pathway to the Future!]]'', ''[[XY123|A Diamond in the Rough!]]'', ''[[XY139|Facing the Needs of the Many!]]'', and ''[[XY140|Till We Compete Again!]]''.

====Other====
A Red Flower Florges appeared in ''[[PK27|Pikachu and the Pokémon Music Squad]]''.

A White Flower Florges appeared in ''[[XY125|A League of His Own!]]'', under the ownership of {{an|Trevor}}. She was used in his battle against [[Alain]] in the [[Lumiose Conference]], only to be defeated by {{TP|Alain|Charizard}}.

==Trivia==
* Florges has the highest base {{stat|Special Defense}} stat of all {{type|Fairy}} Pokémon.
* Florges is the only Pokémon with a base stat total of 552.

===Origin===
Florges appears to be based on {{wp|fairy|fairies}} and {{wp|nymphs}}, in particular {{wp|Anthousai}} due to its floral "hair". Its ornate, flowery "hair" may also be a reference to the 18th century {{wp|pouf}} hairstyle, which was notable in that the style would commonly use decorative items within the hair itself to convey mood and uniqueness. Its body structure resembles that of the {{wp|hyacinth}} flower, which has large sturdy leaves projecting from the base of the stalk. Its design may also draw inspiration from {{wp|mermaids}}.

====Name origin====
Florges may be a combination of ''flora'' and ''gorgeous''.
